intro: Achoriphragma kuramense, commonly known as the Kuramea rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Nyctaginaceae, which includes species known for their showy, often brightly colored flowers. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, small leaves, and clusters of tubular or bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or limestone habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
